website_summaries.verdict: Great reviews became testaments to the plush cushioning, superb durability and reliable upper wrap that the Echelon 5 offers. It’s created for the neutral runner who doesn’t need stability mechanics, but it’s also great for daily use.
pros: Many reviewers and testers applauded the underfoot comfort that’s given by this 5th version of the Echelon series
Runners were allured by the contemporary design and the look of the shoe, making it appealing to casual and advanced athletes
Those with wider feet will be able to get a wider option for this because it has a more accommodating platform
The individual facets of this running shoe truly speak of its capability to last long and stay sturdy even after many uses
The plush cushioning was generally appreciated by testers, particularly those who desire more underfoot comfort
The Echelon 5 is a neutral running shoe that has an intermediate platform with a standard drop of 8mm
cons: Some testers said that the platform of the Saucony Echelon 5 was too wide for their tastes
Others were disappointed at the lack of stability and supportive mechanics that would assist their idle and running stances
The flexibility of this shoe isn’t too prominent, largely because of its feature-filled sole unit
The Echelon 5 also has an overabundance of overlays

customer_reviews.title: I really like these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. The stock insoles are NOT thin, barely-there inserts. Instead, the insoles are nice and cushiony - for real. I had to get these because I wear a 2E. These are nice because: 1) The Brooks version has become too narrow in a wide and no longer seems to accommodate a high arch. 2) The shoes come in a nice color instead of bright yellow/orange/lime etc.
customer_reviews.author: B. York

customer_reviews.title: Work well but wear through quickly
customer_reviews.text: I have a neutral foot and find that these shoes work well for my feet. I will continue to buy them, however, I do wish there was better material in the toe box. The mesh material that they use is not very durable and seems to wear through in no time for me. I’m then left wearing a pair of shoes for a couple months with ugly holes in the upper toe box, until it comes time to replace my shoes again. I may look into buying some material to put in there to reinforce it for me... see if I can get them to last a bit longer. I typically have to replace these shoes every 3-4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Usually like expensive NB
customer_reviews.text: 215 6,1- athletic shape for 31 years old and run heavy...I am very picky! Usually like expensive NB, but I figured Ide try these because of the price and reviews...Perfect fit 10.5 W and I run perfectly... good on knees and shins... I run at least 10 mls a week and in the summer months a few more...These shoes are awesome in or outdoors. I also push hard on them to get 8 minute miles for the Army...Comparable to 125$ NB I have been buying for years...I love the dark blue color and style...I will be looking to buy more of these after I wear them out...I am very happy and recommend this shoe to similar body types.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for Triumphs
customer_reviews.text: I had been wearing the Saucony Triumphs for years, but in my size (13W) they only have one color. The most recent color change was chosen for lovers of cotton candy and dreamsicles! As a person over the age of 20, this was unacceptable. So, I called the Saucony company and they told me the Echelon would have the same support and almost the same cushioning. They were right! Fit is great, support is great, cushioning is good, wish it was great as well. Hoping next generation of Triumphs has a better color scheme.
customer_reviews.author: TomInIll

customer_reviews.title: Made a switch...
customer_reviews.text: Usually an Asics footwear (Nimbus) buyer but decided to give the Sauconu Echelon 5 a try for the reasons of having a wide enough toebox, cushioning for midsole strike and not to mention the price to pay for foot comfort. Whilst Asics is noted for making comfortable footwear with ample cushioning their price range is usually on the high side and of recent their toe-box design has been a bit tighter. These fit as expected and were really light in weight and it felt right all around my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Ish Singh

customer_reviews.title: Correct size finally
customer_reviews.text: Saucony runs a bit smaller than regular casual shoes. Always order a half size larger. I made that mistake a few times. I normally wear 12 wide in other shoes but I finally ordered the Echelon 5 in 12 1/2 wide. Absolutely perfect fit. These are wide enough and the length is perfect with plenty of room. These shoes have a wide sole on the bottom with great stability and balance. The black and blue colors are awesome. Love it. Highly recommended. Excellent quality and cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: LOVE AMAZON

customer_reviews.title: Wide toe box wins!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Now that we have that expressed, I'll tell you about this running shoe as how it is for me. I need a wide toe box and Saucony truly fits this need. Even though I am a female runner, the men's model is a better fit. Probably they are cut wider to accomodate men' s feet. These are so comfortable , well cushioned, offer excellent support. I will probably order more of them.
customer_reviews.author: bevels

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe with flawed inner material
customer_reviews.text: I've now purchased three pairs of this same shoe. I wear an 11.5W and these fit true to size. I've been really happy with the fit and how well they've held up overall. I'd say the only complaint I have is that the material used on the interior deteriorates easily with excess rubbing. The backs of my heals have worn through and the black material comes out. About the time this happens is when I've bought the next pair. I've been to a couple of run stores now and the consensus is this is a common complaint for these shoes but nothing to be too concerned about unless it causes me blisters, which it hasn't so far.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Conner

customer_reviews.title: works great with orthotics
customer_reviews.text: Foot doctor recommended these as they have a wide toe box and are deep, so when you remove, the standard soft cushy insoles, there is plenty of room for orthotics, I have a high arch and neuromas, so my orthotics with neuroma pads and high arch support fit and work great, very hard to find, shoes that are wide and deep for orthotics, I have worn ASICS, Gel Kayanos for 25 years, but every year they get narrower and smaller, so I have given up on them, these Echelon and Brooks Beast are the only shoes that still have a wide and deep toe box, 5 stars all the way
customer_reviews.author: BobG

customer_reviews.title: VERY Comfortable and true to size
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoes! I wanted a neutral shoe and these are fantastic. I normally can't wear Nike because they have a high instep...these are great! I'm a 13 and these fit true to size. Very supportive...Saucony shoes are really good shoes. Normally I would look at Asics or Under Armour...I can recommend these without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron D. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and style
customer_reviews.text: My son immediately felt the comfort when he first put the sneakers on. My son has a wide and flat foot but found comfort with wearing the sneakers without having to add extra arch supports. I am absolutely purchasing another pair in a larger size (To grow in to) and hopefully different color while you still have this style.
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette

customer_reviews.title: by far the most comfortable running or walking shoe I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: by far the most comfortable running or walking shoe I've ever owned...i have 2 pairs now...am looking for a third when price goes lower on these bad dogs! I weight 250, have wide flat feet- and the cushion is amazing
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: For a running shoe that is extremely well padded and comfortable, these are the best I've found
customer_reviews.text: It's taking a little for my feet to get used to them. I think even these shoes arch support, although much much lower than most is a little much, but there is no such thing as a running shoe with zero arch support, so I really cannot fault these shoes too much. For a running shoe that is extremely well padded and comfortable, these are the best I've found!
customer_reviews.author: John  O'Keefe

customer_reviews.title: I love the Saucony Echelon 5 Extra-Wide shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking a long time for a good, wide-width running shoe to replace the discontinued New Balance shoes I used to buy. The Saucony Echelon 5 appears to be the answer, and are even an improvement over the old NB's. They have a firm sole, but a well-cushioned insole, and provide great support. The arches are good, and the tops are generous enough for my high instep. The shoe runs true to traditional sizing, and they are a full size larger than the Asics Cumulus 15's that I own. If you were a fan of the old NB SL2 last, you will like these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mendo

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are stylish and seem like pillows with support on my feet
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy fighting to get smaller-A LOT SMALLER! I need a shoe with support and heel protection! Surprised to find these gems on Amazon, as 15 m I have to shop Big & Tall! Shoes are stylish and seem like pillows with support on my feet! Saucony Rocks! They crushed it out of the park with this great model!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hayes

customer_reviews.title: This shoe gave my foot back after a sever plantars ...
customer_reviews.text: This shoe gave my foot back after a sever plantars fasciitis complication and a torn tendon. It does seem to hold the foot off to the side and force you to roll through the gait. Whatever it does it works, the cushioning on the inside of the foot/arch is very thick and bouncy.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Shoes have been great for running
customer_reviews.text: Shoes have been great for running. I have diabetes and it is difficult to find a comfortable shoe. These have worked very well for me. Running on treadmill 4 times week either a 5 or 10 k. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B. Weeks

customer_reviews.title: ... or fifth pair of these babies and they are pretty consistent with fit and feel
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my fourth or fifth pair of these babies and they are pretty consistent with fit and feel. They don't last as long as I'd like before sort of losing the cushion but I'm a big guy and work them pretty hard. I was originally recommended echelon's by my local running store and I liked the previous generation model better but these are also good. Especially for those with wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: WarmSunSA

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: My Third/fourth pair. Great fit and last a long time. In fact I bought two the last time and still waiting to get the second pair out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer beware

customer_reviews.title: If you need to return these, don’t have to ...
customer_reviews.text: If you need to return these, don’t have to leave the state and miss your cutoff date for the return. I had to go out of state and missed the date and it is impossible to reach anyone by phone, email etc. So now I have a brand new pair of sneakers that are just sitting in a box.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Wood

customer_reviews.title: A bit narrow
customer_reviews.text: The length on these was as expected, but this shoe is very narrow in the mid-foot. It's a stability shoe and pretty stiff as well. I think if you need a stability shoe this would be a good shoe for you.
customer_reviews.author: Koi

customer_reviews.title: but i suspect they would be great for colder weather when i may be wearing heavier ...
customer_reviews.text: A little extra room causes some minor hotspots for me after 5 or so miles, but i suspect they would be great for colder weather when i may be wearing heavier socks. Also, maybe for long runs when my feet swell just a titch.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are literally falling apart more and more each day. The bottom tread is coming off. They squeak when I walk in them, even on carpet. I only wore these shoes casually, I have not run in them. Either these are not the true product, or this lot of shoes was not made properly. I do know that I am now wary of buying Saucony now. $70 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Lacks the quality it once had.
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of these were great. Lasted at least 6 months walking daily at least several miles. This new pair is worthless less than 4 months in. Both shoes have the same lace hole break. It was a very painful walk home. Now I have to look for something else. These cost way too much to break in that short time.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: These make walking a delight
customer_reviews.text: This is my first review for Amazon. Though I enjoy the products and the ease of purchasing from Amazon I have never reviewed a product until now. I have to say that these shoes came straight from heaven. As a large man I find that sneakers are too flimsy to support me when I walk and when I do find a good pair they often do not last long and cost a pretty penny. These shoes, however, are supportive and make walking a delight. The size was perfect, not to tight and not too loose for being wide fit. I am going to purchase another pair right now.
customer_reviews.author: big bunny

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just got these. They are very soft and cushy which is what I wanted for my flat feel. I was feeling some foot pain in my last pair of shoes when running but was able to get through a brisk mile on the treadmill and my feet feel fine. They fit somewhat larger than my old Brooks. 5 stars for now. But I'll see how they hold up in the coming months.
customer_reviews.author: Shakman2k16

customer_reviews.title: These are great!  The wide ones are great if you have narrow heels and a wide toes like me.
customer_reviews.text: This are great for me. I run 5 miles or so 5 days a week. They are the only sneakers that fit me. They are narrow and low in the heel and wide in the toes, which is unusual.
customer_reviews.author: Low Hertz

customer_reviews.title: It fits great, I always get a 1/2 size larger than ...
customer_reviews.text: It fits great, I always get a 1/2 size larger than my foot measures in all shoes just so I have a little more toe room and this fit like a dream, lots of comfort!
customer_reviews.author: HonestBob

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got this before they are gone.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband. Was so glad to get the Echelon 5 before it disappeared. He was fitted with this shoe by a member of the Fleet Feet staff for his plantar fasciitis and had great results.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes -- wore out one pair
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes -- wore out one pair, am glad they're still available for another order. I'm a woman with a wide foot; these have always fit me better than the woman's version.
customer_reviews.author: Cole M.

customer_reviews.title: The 12 EEE were great for my wife foot
customer_reviews.text: Greta shoe. The 12 EEE were great for my wife foot. The arch is mild (good for flat feet). I've walked dozens of miles in them and they still feel great.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: did like the look & theory of the shoe
customer_reviews.text: My foot fell asleep wearing these, huge-massive-like a 8E in width, foot was swimming inside, did like the look & theory of the shoe, but
customer_reviews.author: lance siegel

customer_reviews.title: I love the shoe
customer_reviews.text: The toe box on the tip of shoe outer front the sole is separating from shoe, approx. 1/4 inch missing glue. Factory defect? Please advise, I love the shoe, bu can I please exchange for the same size and style. Respectfully, Dan
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They fit a little tight inside toe box, outer material is subject to cuts and abrasion around toes!
customer_reviews.text: I must use arch supports or they hurt my feet
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: I wear size 14 with a wide foot. Only ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 14 with a wide foot. Only tried them on not sure if I want to keep them because they are a bit too wide. Even after tightening strings. No arch support. Designed for flat foot
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

customer_reviews.title: These are comfortable to start with but don't last very long
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Saucony shoes for close to 10 years now. These are comfortable to start with but don't last very long. 4 months in and they are worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: we love them.
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old son has very flat and wide feet. He loves the shoes! The 1st day he wore them to school he came home and said his feet did not hurt for the 1st time in a long time. They are well worth the price.I have a pair of Saucony women's tennis shoes and this is my sons 2nd pair; we love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable wide width sneakers
customer_reviews.text: For me, I prefer these over new balance. The price is better, they're lighter, come in the same wide options and are way for comfortable. I am 6' 3" and 300 lbs and these are super comfortable all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Broo77777

customer_reviews.title: ... pair of these shoes at a local store and loved them for walking
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these shoes at a local store and loved them for walking, so when I saw these same pair of shoes on Amazon at a lower price, I decided I wanted to get another pair. After six months I decided was ready to start using the new pair of shoes, after a month of using them the bottom soul of the right shoe came apart and fell off. Now I have a pair of new shoes with one shoe missing it's bottom soul. Real DISAPPOINTED....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: the width was too narrow, I didn't care for the cut out between the shoes laces.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: and comfortable. I don't run much but spend a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: Very cushiony, and comfortable. I don't run much but spend a lot of time on my feet. They do however make you 1 to 1.5 inch taller, seems more than any other shoe which isn'ta bad thing. I have yet to train in them but bought these because of other reviews. So far they have not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Sloan

customer_reviews.title: from the first time I put them on they felt amazing, I've never felt a fit so well on ...
customer_reviews.text: I hardly ever review anything but I'm going to for these, first off I have a wide foot so finding quality running shoes that's 4E is a hard ordeal, but I found these, from the first time I put them on they felt amazing, I've never felt a fit so well on the first time putting them on I'm using the sneakers for a half marathon, and my runs are a lot smoother and a lot less impact with the cushioning 3 runs in and I've felt no discomfort from after my runs, in fact even my legs feel fresh after the runs, overall I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Demetrius Wilson

customer_reviews.title: WELL WORTH THE MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a very comfortable shoe!!! Ran in them 4 times so far, fit is really good! Heal box is very comfortable, cushioning and collar feels good, toe box is just a little bit small (not enough to bother me though!). Will re-review after approx 30 runs in them.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: OK but wanted them to be perfect
customer_reviews.text: very wide for 4E but also comfotable. did not have a good arch support had to add my own. I would buy again but get them on sale
customer_reviews.author: Coach Parker

customer_reviews.title: This is a great shoe if you hate the hard medial post on ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the shoe I have been searching for! I have wide, flat feet, but I don't over pronate. This is a great shoe if you hate the hard medial post on guidance or over supportive shoes. Great base for your feet, no hard post in the arch area. Will buy more again and again! If Saucony keeps making this shoe this will be my go-to-shoe from now on!!! Wonderful!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Monti

customer_reviews.title: Saucony makes a great shoe. These felt a little heavy but the ...
customer_reviews.text: Saucony makes a great shoe. These felt a little heavy but the cushioning is just right for this clydesdale runner. Wish they had some better colors.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Too bad Saucony and Brooks and other shoe companies have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Too bad Saucony and Brooks and other shoe companies have to screw up a good shoe. This shoe is awesome. The echelon 6 is horrible - uncomfortable and the toe box looks cheap as heck. I love the echelon 5. The 6 is awful.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Flintstone Feet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes. Shoes fit perfectly right out of the box and we're very comfortable to wear. They really help with my flat feet. They are light. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Galactus1967

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe. Has held up well. Great wide fit.
customer_reviews.author: all set

customer_reviews.title: The newer Echelon 6 is not as supportive or comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon was the only place I could find this out-of-production shoe. I’ve worn out many previous pairs. The newer Echelon 6 is not as supportive or comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: rfulmr

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, simple solution, no prescription required
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, Simple , Easy , Comfy, reduces the problem, as described
customer_reviews.author: Daven Technocrat

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes so far. Not too soft. Not too hard. Doesn't cause me to pronate or supinate.
customer_reviews.author: Sam R.

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes I have ever worn straight out the box
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes I have ever worn straight out the box. I do a lot of walking and I'm thinking about getting myself another pair of these shoes. I don't care for the white base.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and extremely comfortable. I’ve had a lot of Saucony shoes and these are like walking and running on a cloud!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: These fit well and give great stability to my stride
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable for walking and everyday use. I use powerstep inserts with them.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Superb fit and support. Excellent construction and durability.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Echelon's. These are by far the most comfortable shoes I have ever owned--and it is fantastic that they are also running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: M. Evans

customer_reviews.title: 5th pair
customer_reviews.text: These are the only athletic shoes I like. I have had 5 pair. This pair is the exact same size and type, but a little bigger, so my foot slides around some. was not able to return them as I needed them for work and not sure if it would have changed anything.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: ... for CrossFit because they are flat and I feel like I can lift in them
customer_reviews.text: I use these for CrossFit because they are flat and I feel like I can lift in them. Also I like running in them. Pretty comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Payne

customer_reviews.title: Defective Shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband and myself have worn Saucony's for a long time. We love the, but this pair was defective. The bottom sole started peeling off after about 2 months. I contacted Amazon who told me to contact the seller who told me to contact Amazon. Nothing was done to replace the defective item.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Wesseloo

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Comfort, and Health
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are so comfortable and are one of the few recommended for custom orthotics. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: DocRomeroED

customer_reviews.title: Continues to be a good shoe for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of these shoes. My situations results in about 6 months of use, which is normal for me with athletic shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ken E.

customer_reviews.title: I would prefer tp purchase these in person for corect sizing
customer_reviews.text: An little small and I found then a bit narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: I have tried several Brooks and New Balance shoes in my quest for a comfortable walking shoe and running if that were my bag
customer_reviews.text: I dont write many reviews for stuff. I have size 10 feet 4e or wider and VERY FLAT. I have tried several Brooks and New Balance shoes in my quest for a comfortable walking shoe and running if that were my bag. Never have I ordered a 3e as that is all this brand seems to make. I fully expected to ship it right back. BEST F'n Shoes I have ever worn with my Hobbit feet. 3E fits like a 4e and the width is great all around. This is truly exciting for me. I have not had shoes like this all my life of 46 years. I hope my fellow flat footers find the comfort I have.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Burkhardt

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought a second pair.
customer_reviews.text: I've always loved the Echelon shoe. I wore out my last 5's and just couldn't wait until the 6's came out so I bought another pair of 5's. I like the cushioned fit of these running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great shoes. Firm heel box, upright build and flex for toes during stride. Love em.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lawrenson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Slightly snug fit, hoping they will stretch out with wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Jannette B.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased these for my father and he loves them. ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my father and he loves them. we have actually ordered him an additional pair as well.
customer_reviews.author: harmonquinn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes and Amazon often has them at a better price that the normal retail stores.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for supinators...
customer_reviews.text: Best shoes for supination...or wider feet...love them have bought manntimes
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a wide foot and has a difficult time finding a good walking shoe. He was glad to discover this one.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Jones

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: most comfortable shoe I have now. I love this shoe
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just got them a couple days ago. seem ok, time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Rummel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable walking shoes I have. Only defect is that they are NOT waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Marlow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Recommend order one size larger than usual size . Good for walking shoe .
customer_reviews.author: Eric T.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I have very flat feet, which leads to foot and knee pain. These have held up for months. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: max silver

customer_reviews.title: Shipping was excellent. The shoes are great for my flat feet
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was excellent. The shoes are great for my flat feet. If you're looking for a shoe to run in and you have flat feet, definitely check these out.
customer_reviews.author: you should read this book

customer_reviews.title: Easy shopping experience
customer_reviews.text: ordered my shoes in the AM and received them that early evening. Crazy good service! Shoes were exactly the ones I wanted and fit great. I love shopping like this
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Always have had flat feet and running wasn't great. I love these shoes running is fun again.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin Galvez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Need more support on the exterior part of the foot.
customer_reviews.author: Fher

customer_reviews.title: the more I wore them the better they felt
customer_reviews.text: Thought they were too small but, the more I wore them the better they felt. Glad I didn't send back.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Great neutral shoe for Extra wide feet
customer_reviews.text: These are comparable to Brooks Dyad 8. Very comfortable. Love they come in large widths. They look great too. No complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Holland

customer_reviews.title: SWEET FIT!
customer_reviews.text: So far the Echelon 5 fits like a glove after I put in my own inserts- which the shoe was designed for.
customer_reviews.author: Rhythmman

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Avid Saucony fan, light weight, comfortable and fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hoang Farley

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable. Lots of support
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable. Lots of support. Best shoe for exercise and walking.
customer_reviews.author: Tula

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes on 4/15 and in less than 1 month they are falling apart. The soles are coming off of the shoe. This was my first and probably last Saucony purchase.

customer_reviews.author: Chris Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: I am a really bad supinator. I have had pain in my feet ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a really bad supinator. I have had pain in my feet and knees for the last several years because I wasn't wearing the right shoe. These shoes fixed my supination immediately. They are built up very well around the heel which keeps me from rolling my foot. The insole is removable, but it is very comfortable. I don't really have arch problems so the factory insole did fine for me. Took these to Disneyworld and walked at least 30k steps a day for a week and they held up great. They are also very breathable. I am not a runner, so I am reviewing these from the standpoint of just average wearing and walking.

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's Echelon 5 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Saucony Echelon 5 Supportive neutral shoe which provides an accommodating fit for orthotic wearers. The latest increment in running perfection. Compromised with lighter materials whilst still remaining inherently neutral, the Echelon 5 combines durability and cushioning with equal aplomb. Upper The Saucony Echelon 5 Running Shoes breathable mesh upper is straddled by a series of synthetic overlays that reinforce its construction, to deliver a shoe that is simultaneously lightweight, breathable and robust. In an update from previous iterations a 5mm, antimicrobial polyurethane sockliner enhances support and cushioning, whilst ARCH-LOCK envelopes the medial arch and integrates with the lacing system to deliver a secure, adaptive midfoot lockdown that can be manipulated by tightening the shoe. A RUNDRY collar lining intelligently wicks moisture away from the skin and works in concert with the antimicrobial sockliner to encourage an environment that is cooler, drier and fresher. Reflective components positioned at the heel and toe preserve the wearer's visibility in poor light. Midsole A full length POWERGRID insert cushions the foot and attenuates impact shockwaves superbly, working with the primary midsole compound - a Saucony SuperLite (SSL) EVA blend - to deliver a phenomenally smooth ride. An added feature to an already elite running platform consists of a SRC Impact Zone, implemented to attenuate shock and disperse impact forces away from the shoe. The result...a more efficient run setting up the foot for a smooth transition. Outsole The shoe's outsole consists of an iBR+ and XT-900 compound blend - the former yielding 3 times more impact absorption than other comparable materials, albeit in a considerably lighter format, and the latter delivering consistent, reliable grip and traction with a superb longevity.
feature_bullets: Road training shoe with stablizing midsole and removable footbed to accomodate orthotics
Run Dry water-resistant lining ; 6mm PU sockliner for superior comfort, cushioning and durability
8mm heel-to-toe offset ; Support Frame enhances rear foot stability upon impact.
